		Question: who was ptolemy and what did he do
		Answer:
answer: Ptolemy was an astronomer, geographer, and mathematician who lived in the 2nd century AD. He is best known for his work on astronomy, particularly his astronomical models, which were used for centuries to predict the positions of the planets and stars. He also wrote a treatise on geography, which was the most comprehensive work on the subject in the ancient world.
